<h1 class="govuk-heading-xl govuk-!-margin-top-6 govuk-!-margin-bottom-6">The basics</h1>

```{python}
import io
import contextlib
import html

examples = [
    {
        "title": "Strings",
        "code": 'print("Hello, world!")',
    },
    {
        "title": "Formulas",
        "code": 'print(round((1 + 3) * (9 - 2) / 3, 2))',
    },
    {
        "title": "Variables",
        "code": (
            'test_var_text = "Hello again!"\n'
            'test_var_formula = 4 + 5\n'
            'print(test_var_formula)\n'
            'print(test_var_text)'
        ),
    },
    {
        "title": "Formulated variables",
        "code": (
            'test_var_formula = 100\n'
            'test_var_formula = test_var_formula + 100\n'
            'print(test_var_formula)'
        ),
    },
    {
        "title": "Combined variables",
        "code": (
            'num_years = 4\n'
            'days_per_year = 365\n'
            'hours_per_day = 24\n'
            'mins_per_hour = 60\n'
            'secs_per_min = 60\n'
            'total_secs = secs_per_min * mins_per_hour * hours_per_day * days_per_year * num_years\n'
            'print(total_secs)'
        ),
    },
]

html_output = []

for ex in examples:
    # Capture code output
    buf = io.StringIO()
    with contextlib.redirect_stdout(buf):
        exec(ex["code"])
    output = buf.getvalue()
    # Escape code and output for HTML
    code_html = html.escape(ex["code"])
    output_html = html.escape(output)
    # Build HTML block
    block = f'''
<div class="govuk-body govuk-!-margin-bottom-6">
  <h3>{ex["title"]}</h3>
  <pre><code class="language-python">{code_html}</code></pre>
  <div><strong>Output:</strong></div>
  <pre>{output_html}</pre>
</div>
'''
    html_output.append(block)

with open("examples.html", "w", encoding="utf-8") as f:
    f.write("\n".join(html_output))
```
